dict.string: ‚åò‚èé Save note ¬∑ ‚áß‚èé Preview note ¬∑ ‚åÉ‚èé View pads ¬∑ ‚åò‚áß‚èé Next pad ¬∑ ‚éã Cancel

# on save, persist the active pad for next time
active=$active_pad
cat <<EOF | osascript tell application id "com.runningwithcrayons.Alfred" set theWorkflow to "${alfred_workflow_bundleid}" set activePad to "active_pad" set activeNum to "$active" set configuration activePad to value activeNum in workflow theWorkflow reload workflow theWorkflow end tell EOF

typeset -i active active=$active_pad
if [[ $active -eq $pad_count ]]; then active=1 else ((active+=1)) fi
echo -n $active

![](icon.png)
# Scratchpad
Quickly access up to nine ephemeral scratchpads for spontaneous note-taking.
üü° üü† üî¥ üü£ üîµ üü¢
> **Scratchpad** is lightweight and flexible, ideal for seamless ad-hoc note-taking, brainstorming, prototyping, temporary to-do lists, jotting down thoughts, sketching ideas, instantly responding to new information as it emerges, and anything else that requires a notepad in a moment's notice.
The workflow is adopting the Tot-approach, deliberately limiting the available workspaces to keep things simple and avoid distracting overhead.
--- Created by [Patrick Sy](https://github.com/zeitlings) | [Visit on Github](https://github.com/zeitlings/alfred-workflows) | [Visit on Alfred Forum](https://www.alfredforum.com/topic/21812-scratchpad/) ---
## Setup
1. Define the two keyboard shortcuts, e.g. <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>P</kbd> for the __primary__ entry point and <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚åÉ</kbd><kbd>P</kbd> for the __secondary__ entry point. 2. Decide on how many scratchpads you would like to use. 3. Select a preferred file extension, if you have one. 4. Optionally select a location where you want the notes to be created and stored.
## Usage
1. Press the __primary__ [Hotkey](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/triggers/hotkey/) to open the scratchpad that was last used. * Press the Hotkey again or <kbd>‚éã</kbd> to dismiss the scratchpad without saving. 2. Press the __secondary__ Hotkey or enter the workflow's [Keyword](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/workflows/inputs/keyword/) `pad` to view all scratchpads and to search their contents.
![Markdown Mode Preview](images/previews/markdown-mode.png)
In __Editing Mode__ * <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to save changes.¬π * <kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to preview as rendered markdown. * <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to view all pads and search your notes. * <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to cycle through your scratchpads.
In __Markdown Mode__ * <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> (or <kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd>) to start editing. * <kbd>‚å•</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to view all pads and search your notes. * <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>‚áß</kbd><kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to cycle through your scratchpads. * <kbd>‚éã</kbd> to either cancel or go back through previously viewed pads.
![Pad Switcher Preview](images/previews/pad-switcher.png) ![Pad Search Preview](images/previews/pad-search.png)
- __Type__ to filter scratchpads based on your query.¬≤ - <kbd>‚Ü©</kbd> to open the pad. - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>L</kbd> on a filtered pad to view the matched line as [Large Type](https://www.alfredapp.com/help/features/large-type/). - <kbd>‚åò</kbd><kbd>Y</kbd> (or tap <kbd>‚áß</kbd>) to Quick Look preview the pad.
---
### Footnotes
¬π Changes are also saved when previewing and when switching the active pad. ¬≤ When searching for a pad containing a keyword, the first matching line is used as subtitle.

Since we are stacking the View and don't reload the workflow when cycling through pads in Markdown mode, we can step back into previous views by pressing ‚éã
Ensure we continue in Editor Mode
Ensure we continue in Markdown mode
Ensure we continue in Markdown mode
The keyword activates the Quick Switcher.
Select a folder if you want to save your notes in a specific location. (Optional)
